sentences.english: Such had been his first dip into the dark abysses of existence.
sentences.chinese: 他第一次跌进人生黑暗深渊的情形就是这样。

sentences.english: There was no recurrence after six months of follow-up.
sentences.chinese: 术后经六个月追踪没有复发的情形。

sentences.english: "Labour won't stand by and let this continue, " David Cunliffe said.
sentences.chinese: 工党不会坐视不管，任由这种情形持续。

sentences.english: A king who exercises his authority over his subjects is quite acceptable.
sentences.chinese: 国王施威于臣民是完全可以接受的一种情形。

sentences.english: Obert: I see that would create a conflict of interest.
sentences.chinese: 我了解这会造成利益冲突的情形。

sentences.english: The executioner had never seen anything like this!
sentences.chinese: 刽子手从来没见过这种情形。

sentences.english: In both cases, attributes are usually better for unordered data.
sentences.chinese: 在这两种情形中，通常属性适合于无序的数据。

sentences.english: Similar conditions are to be found in other countries.
sentences.chinese: 在其他国家也会发现同样的情形。

sentences.english: The pain had become constant in the last two months and was associated with diarrhea and tenesmus.
sentences.chinese: 近二个月有持续疼痛的情形，且合并腹泻及裹急后重。

sentences.english: It is rather to be thought of than expressed what was now my condition.
sentences.chinese: 我现在的情形是只可意会，不可言传的。

sentences.english: Other circumstances in which the experts' conclusion cannot be as the evidence upon the cross-examination.
sentences.chinese: 经过质证认定不能作为证据使用的其他情形。

sentences.english: The same applied to parents with three or four children.
sentences.chinese: 此情形同样适用于有三个或四个孩子的父母。

sentences.english: It is proved that the Fermat Grand Theorem is tenable in the first case.
sentences.chinese: 证明了费尔马大定理第一情形成立。

sentences.english: In those circumstances, their underreported income would go undetected.
sentences.chinese: 这种情形下，他们少报的收入并未被发现。

sentences.english: Competitors are allowed to touch the first hold(s), without leaving the ground with both their feet.
sentences.chinese: 选手在双脚未离地的情形下，得碰触起攀点。

definition: provision/to fix/to set/to formulate/to stipulate/to provide/regulation/rule/CL:個|个[ge4]
persons involved or implicated/party (to an affair)
main content/matter/work/origin of an incident/cause/purpose/subject (of business letter)
